title: Watkins Harper The Slave Auction - audience

content.question: By addressing the audience directly in the last two stanzas of the poem, Frances Ellen Watkins Harper most likely sought to

choices.label: celebrate the resilience of enslaved African Americans by focusing on individuals fighting against slave auctions
highlight important age- and gender-specific differences in the experiences of enslaved African Americans by examining the treatment of young girls, mothers, and men
advance the cause of abolition by emphasizing the shared humanity of enslaved African Americans
argue that the experience of losing a family member by being separated from them through enslavement was much better than experiencing the death of a family member

content.answer: advance the cause of abolition by emphasizing the shared humanity of enslaved African Americans
